definition:
A prize awarded every year to one or two (sometimes three), scientists
in certain fields not covered by the Nobel Prize (specifically,
mathematics, biology and astronomy) at a congress of the Royal Swedish
Academy of Sciences. The cash value of the award in 2006 was
$US\$500,000$.

Holger Crafoord, the inventor of the artificial kidney, founded the
award in his testament. The first recipients received the award in 1982.
Since then the award has been periodic.
